result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan T Scalice was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
---------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
---------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.   Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
---------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
---------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
---------------------

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan T Scalice

records.addlTxt:
8:37 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Jordan T Scalice in court with attorney Kate Frigo Drury.  
Matter is before the Court for hearing on a decision on special disposition.  
The parties have not reached an agreement. 
8:38 am  Argument by Atty Drury.  
8:44 am  Argument by Atty Herrmann.  
8:47 am  Defendant does not have any statement.  
8:48 am  Court takes brief recess to consider this matter. 
8:52 am  Court in session.  Court makes findings and denies request for special disposition.  
8:53 am  Court in recess.
